column5: Wanted a friend. a friend who owns a boat. a friend who owns a boat who needs a friend. a friend who owns a boat who needs a friend to go fishing this weekend at long point  Bored...
Hahaha. You can always try plentyoffish.com

It's your lucky day   according to the Long Point Page , Big Dave is looking for 2 walk-ons to fill his charter tomorrow. This boat typically limits out on jumbo erie perch, try a call.  http://www.longpoint.on.ca/images/adrotator/bigdaveflyer.pdf

I found hanging around a boat launch with a subway bag with 2 sandwiches a cooler and a $10.00 bill taped to your forehead will break the ice and get you a spot on your new not yet found friend.   Art
LM** wow that was a good one !
Art, you my man are funny but i bet it would work !!!!
Just hang around a dock fishing. You see a fella going out alone,you start talking and you will be surprised. Just dont get goofy.  I did this once,and made a great friend from it.
Wish i could sir. I work all weekend. If you want to hit LPB on the holiday monday, give me a shout. I have 3 boats to choose from.
No, her name was Marsha but don't tell Betty!

LOL Brudder   No this was when I first moved to Barrie. I was a fishing crazy guy then. Fished when ever I could. Thats why I moved up here. One day I was fishing the marina,and this older fella was launching his boat. I gave him a hand tieing it up,and watched it for him as he parked the truck and trailer. When he returned,he asked if I would like to join him. Why sure,and the rest is history.  This didnt work all the time,as some would just say thanks and be on their way.
